dir="auto">The following call checks that the script is associated with the zone. In this case, it's the only script added by this user.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ cli4 /user/workers/scripts[    {        "created_on": "2018-02-15T00:00:00.000000Z",        "etag": "1234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234",        "id": "example-com",        "modified_on": "2018-02-15T00:00:00.000000Z"    }]$"><pre>$ cli4 /user/workers/scripts[    {        <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>created_on<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>2018-02-15T00:00:00.000000Z<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,        <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>etag<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>1234567890123456789012345678901234567890123456789012345678901234<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,        <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>id<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>example-com<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,        <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>modified_on<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>2018-02-15T00:00:00.000000Z<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>    }]$</pre></div><p dir="auto">Next step is to make sure a route is added for that script on that zone.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ cli4 --post pattern="example.com/*" script="example-com" /zones/:example.com/workers/routes{    "id": "12345678901234567890123456789012"}$$ cli4 /zones/:example.com/workers/routes[    {        "id": "12345678901234567890123456789012",        "pattern": "example.com/*",        "script": "example-com"    }]$"><pre>$ cli4 --post pattern=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>example.com/*<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> script=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>example-com<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> /zones/:example.com/workers/routes{    <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>id<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>12345678901234567890123456789012<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>}$$ cli4 /zones/:example.com/workers/routes[    {        <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>id<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>12345678901234567890123456789012<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,        <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>pattern<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>example.com/*<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,        <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>script<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>example-com<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>    }]$</pre></div><p dir="auto">With that script added to the zone and the route added, we can now see the website has been modified because of the Cloudflare Worker.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ curl -sS https://example.com/ | fgrep '<body'  <body style="background: #ff0;">$"><pre>$ curl -sS https://example.com/ <span class="pl-k">|</span> fgrep <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span><body<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>  <span class="pl-k"><</span>body style=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>background: #ff0;<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span><span class="pl-k">></span>$</pre></div><p dir="auto">All this can be removed; hence bringing the website back to its initial state.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ cli4 --delete /zones/:example.com/workers/script12345678901234567890123456789012$ cli4 --delete /zones/:example.com/workers/routes/:12345678901234567890123456789012true$$ curl -sS https://example.com/ | fgrep '<body'  <body>$"><pre>$ cli4 --delete /zones/:example.com/workers/script12345678901234567890123456789012$ cli4 --delete /zones/:example.com/workers/routes/:12345678901234567890123456789012<span class="pl-c1">true</span>$$ curl -sS https://example.com/ <span class="pl-k">|</span> fgrep <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span><body<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>  <span class="pl-k"><</span>body<span class="pl-k">></span>$</pre></div><p dir="auto">Refer to the Cloudflare Workers API documentation for more information.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" files were use for training.That said, the example code is here to show how the API works vs testing the AI/ML quality.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ python examples/example_ai_speechrecognition.pymp3 received: length=700367My fellow Americans, Michelle and I have been so touched by all the well wishes that we've received over the past few weeks. But tonight, tonight it's my turn to say thanks.$"><pre>$ python examples/example_ai_speechrecognition.pymp3 received: length=700367My fellow Americans, Michelle and I have been so touched by all the well wishes that we<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>ve received over the past few weeks. But tonight, tonight it<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>s my turn to say thanks.$</pre></div><p dir="auto">This is presently work-in-progress because of the non-Python calling method. The syntax could change in the future.</p><p dir="auto">They can also be called via <code>cli4</code>.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ cli4 --image --post text="I'll have an order of the moule frites" source_lang=english target_lang=french /accounts/:AccountID/ai/run/@cf/meta/m2m100-1.2b{'translated_text': 'Je vais avoir une commande des frites de moule'}$"><pre>$ cli4 --image --post text=<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>I'll have an order of the moule frites<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span> source_lang=english target_lang=french /accounts/:AccountID/ai/run/@cf/meta/m2m100-1.2b{<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>translated_text<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>Je vais avoir une commande des frites de moule<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>}$</pre></div><p dir="auto">Presently you will need the following in your <code>cloudflare.cfg</code> file.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ cat ~/.cloudflare/cloudflare.cfg[CloudFlare]global_request_timeout = 120max_request_retries = 1extras =    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/meta/llama-2-7b-chat-fp16    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/meta/llama-2-7b-chat-int8    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/mistral/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.1    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/openai/whisper    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/meta/m2m100-1.2b    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/huggingface/distilbert-sst-2-int8    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/microsoft/resnet-50    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/stabilityai/stable-diffusion-xl-base-1.0    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/baai/bge-base-en-v1.5    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/baai/bge-large-en-v1.5    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/baai/bge-small-en-v1.5$"><pre>$ cat <span class="pl-k">~</span>/.cloudflare/cloudflare.cfg[CloudFlare]global_request_timeout = 120max_request_retries = 1extras =    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/meta/llama-2-7b-chat-fp16    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/meta/llama-2-7b-chat-int8    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/mistral/mistral-7b-instruct-v0.1    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/openai/whisper    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/meta/m2m100-1.2b    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/huggingface/distilbert-sst-2-int8    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/microsoft/resnet-50    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/stabilityai/stable-diffusion-xl-base-1.0    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/baai/bge-base-en-v1.5    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/baai/bge-large-en-v1.5    /accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/baai/bge-small-en-v1.5$</pre></div><p dir="auto">As the <code>@</code> (at) symbol and the <code>.</code> (dot) symbol aren't allowed in python variable names; you'll have the replace <code>@cf</code> with <code>at_cf</code> and <code>.</code> with <code>_</code>.There's already notes above that state that <code>-</code> (dash) is replaced with <code>_</code> in the code.That will be needed with some model names.</p><p dir="auto">The <code>cli4</code> command does not need this edit. It is done on the fly!</p><p dir="auto">For example, the following code is valid:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="    r = cf.accounts.ai.run.at_cf.openai.whisper.post(account_id, data=audio_data)    r = cf.accounts.ai.run.at_cf.meta.m2m100_1_2b.post(account_id, data=translate_data)    r = cf.accounts.ai.run.at_cf.stabilityai.stable_diffusion_xl_base_1_0.post(account_id, data=image_create_data)"><pre>    <span class="pl-s1">r</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">cf</span>.<span class="pl-s1">accounts</span>.<span class="pl-s1">ai</span>.<span class="pl-s1">run</span>.<span class="pl-s1">at_cf</span>.<span class="pl-s1">openai</span>.<span class="pl-s1">whisper</span>.<span class="pl-en">post</span>(<span class="pl-s1">account_id</span>, <span class="pl-s1">data</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s1">audio_data</span>)    <span class="pl-s1">r</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">cf</span>.<span class="pl-s1">accounts</span>.<span class="pl-s1">ai</span>.<span class="pl-s1">run</span>.<span class="pl-s1">at_cf</span>.<span class="pl-s1">meta</span>.<span class="pl-s1">m2m100_1_2b</span>.<span class="pl-en">post</span>(<span class="pl-s1">account_id</span>, <span class="pl-s1">data</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s1">translate_data</span>)    <span class="pl-s1">r</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">cf</span>.<span class="pl-s1">accounts</span>.<span class="pl-s1">ai</span>.<span class="pl-s1">run</span>.<span class="pl-s1">at_cf</span>.<span class="pl-s1">stabilityai</span>.<span class="pl-s1">stable_diffusion_xl_base_1_0</span>.<span class="pl-en">post</span>(<span class="pl-s1">account_id</span>, <span class="pl-s1">data</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s1">image_create_data</span>)</pre></div><p dir="auto">Or you can use the <code>find()</code> call can will do this conversion for you.</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-python notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="    translate_data = {'text':"I'll have an order of the moule frites", 'source_lang':'english', 'target_lang':'french'}    m = cf.find('/accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/meta/m2m100-1.2b')    r = m.post(account_id, data=translate_data)    print(r['translated_text'])"><pre>    <span class="pl-s1">translate_data</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> {<span class="pl-s">'text'</span>:<span class="pl-s">"I'll have an order of the moule frites"</span>, <span class="pl-s">'source_lang'</span>:<span class="pl-s">'english'</span>, <span class="pl-s">'target_lang'</span>:<span class="pl-s">'french'</span>}    <span class="pl-s1">m</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">cf</span>.<span class="pl-en">find</span>(<span class="pl-s">'/accounts/:id/ai/run/@cf/meta/m2m100-1.2b'</span>)    <span class="pl-s1">r</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s1">m</span>.<span class="pl-en">post</span>(<span class="pl-s1">account_id</span>, <span class="pl-s1">data</span><span class="pl-c1">=</span><span class="pl-s1">translate_data</span>)    <span class="pl-en">print</span>(<span class="pl-s1">r</span>[<span class="pl-s">'translated_text'</span>])</pre></div><p dir="auto">You will also have to run with a version of the library above <code>2.18.2</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Implemented API calls</h2><a position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="$ cat ~/.cloudflare/cloudflare.cfg[Cloudflare]extras =    /client/v4/command    /client/v4/command/:command_identifier /client/v4/command/:command_identifier    /client/v4/command/:command_identifier/settings$</pre></div><p dir="auto">While it's easy to call anything within Cloudflare's API, it's not very useful to The new <code>SyntaxWarning</code> messages (i.e. <code>SyntaxWarning: "is" with a literal. Did you mean "=="?</code>) meant minor edits were needed.</p><p dir="auto">As of late 2023 the code is Python3.11 clean.</p><p dir="auto">As of February 2024 the code is officially marked as 3.x only (3.5 and above to be specific) such that it can become PEP561 specific.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">pypi and GitHub signed
